meanings.definition: To inquire impertinently or unnecessarily into something
meanings.sent1: She kept prying into my personal life, asking too many questions.
meanings.sent2: The detective was prying for information about the case.
meanings.sent3: The nosy neighbor was prying into everyone's business again.
meanings.sent4: Her prying eyes seemed to see through walls, uncovering secrets effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The journalist's prying nature made her a master at uncovering scandals.

meanings.sent1: The child was prying at the interesting bugs under the rock.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help prying at the mysterious package on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat prying at the birds outside the window, wishing to join them.
meanings.sent4: His prying gaze made her feel uncomfortable, as if he could see into her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's prying eyes scanned the ancient ruins, searching for hidden treasures.

meanings.definition: To move or force open or apart
meanings.sent1: He was prying open the stuck drawer with a screwdriver.
meanings.sent2: The burglar was prying the window open to gain entry into the house.
meanings.sent3: The crowbar was used for prying the wooden boards apart.
meanings.sent4: The strong winds were prying the doors of the old barn open.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was prying the engine cover off to access the faulty part.
